creator: gregor@apache.org
joerg.heinicke@gmx.de
text:
NoClassDefFoundError means the class was there at compile time but is not found
at runtime. When rebuilding Neko with Xerces 2.6.2 the error should occur on
compile time or the class is not really needed (FOP includes Jini and JAI that
way). Maybe a rebuild helps here. Have you informed Xerces developers of that issue?

Joerg

creator: gregor@apache.org
text: we will investigate again after 1.4 and ship with xerces 2.6.1

Gregor J. Rothfuss wrote:

> it seems that xerces 2.6.2 removed ObjectFactory which broke nekopull if i
understand the exception correctly.


Strange. The change log doesn't explicitly state that this
class was removed so it must be part of another "fix". I'll
have to look into this more because I think I use that util
class in NekoHTML as well.

> i have posted a bug report with a stack trace at
>
> http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27341


I looked at the stack trace and it references a Forrest
class that doesn't seem to exist: SourceTypeAction in the
org.apache.forrest.components.sourcetype package. Is this
class generated or something during the build? Because I
just did a checkout of the Forrest code and didn't find
it there. There is, however, a class with that name in
the org.apache.cocoon.acting.sourcetype package.

I also looked through all of the Java source files and
could only find a single class that used NekoPull. And it
looks like it's just to read the root element. Seems like
SAX could easily have been used by extending DefaultHandler
and throwing a SAXException in startElement to end the
parse early.

-- 
Andy Clark * andyc@apache.org
creator: gregor@apache.org
